alert.note: Alert for Clay; Marshall; Pottawatomie; Riley; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 11:10PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Riley, northwestern Pottawatomie, northeastern Clay, eastern Washington and western Marshall Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Washington to 5 miles southeast of Clay Center. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clay Center, Marysville, Washington, Blue Rapids, Riley, Hanover, Waterville, Leonardville, Linn, Greenleaf, Olsburg, Randolph, Barnes, Morrowville, Green, Palmer, Bremen and Tuttle Creek Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for north central and northeastern Kansas.
